N48.Q: There are four amendments to the Constitution about who can vote. Describe one of them.
N48.C1: Citizens eighteen (18) and older can vote

N48.C3: Only citizens with a job can vote
N48.C4: Citizens by birth only can vote

N51.C2: Freedom of speech and freedom to run for president
N51.C3: Freedom of religion and freedom to make treaties with other countries
N51.C4: Freedom to disobey the traffic law and freedom to petition

N53.C4: No defend the Constitution and laws of United States
